summary: Fixes the annoying crash after exactly 15 minutes of playing due to an annoying Windows 10 service conflict. Compatible with Skyrim classic and Special Edition.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Do you play Skyrim under Windows 10 ?
Does the game crash [b][u]exactly every 15 minutes[/u][/b], despite your best efforts with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72725]crash fixes[/url]﻿, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73618]ENBboost crash fixes[/url]﻿, etc. ?

Then this may help you ![/size]

[color=#a4c2f4][size=4][b]What does it fix ?[/b][/size][/color]

On Windows 10, there is an unexplained incompatibility between Skyrim and the Tablet Input Service (tabtip.exe), which causes Skyrim to crash (CTD) on the 15 minute mark.

It allows you to play Skyrim for more than 15 minutes on a touch/pen enabled PC on Windows 10, while retaining the touch function while not playing.

[color=#a4c2f4][size=4][b]
Why was this made ?[/b][/size][/color]

I came across this while searching why, despite all my best efforts, and using several crash fix mods, my game seemed to crash in whatever circumstances, even with just my character standing there in her house.
Then I noticed that crashes seemed to occur every 15 minutes, and found [url=https://bethesda.net/community/topic/5457/15-minute-crash-bug-resolved/5]several[/url]﻿ [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/72850/discussions/0/490125737464717517/]links[/url]﻿ (etc.) pointing to an incompatibility with the touch service.

Lo and behold, I tried that, and Skyrim ran way better. At least it did survive the 15 minute crash threshold.

But, I needed this service, because I also use touch on my PC, and didn't want to lose either the touch functionality, or enduring Skyrim crashes, so the solution of just disabling the service was not applicable to my use case.


[color=#a4c2f4][size=4][b]What does it NOT fix ?[/b][/size][/color]

[color=#f1c232][b]Please note that this only fixes the [u]15 minute crash[/u] for people that have the touch input service enabled on [u]Windows 10[/u], e.g. people with laptops, using Wacom pen tablets, etc., since the service is manually started by default, and should automatically start only if there is a peripheral using it.
[/b][/color]
It will not fix anything related to the game engine, your uGridsToLoad, memory, Papyrus scripts, etc. It specifically, only, fixes this one particular cause of crash.


[color=#a4c2f4][size=4][b]How does it work ?[/b][/size][/color]

Basically, this is a little launcher. It gets the service state when it starts, disables and stops it, launches Skyrim, and restores the initial service state after Skyrim terminates.

Why use a launcher ? Well, I didn't know how to code a SKSE DLL, plus with Skyrim being a bit finicky and crashing for many other causes, it seemed safer to just wait for the process to exit.

- Auto detects Skyrim/SSE install paths from the registry and determines which is installed and where
- [b][color=#ffd966]If the user has both Skyrim and SSE :[/color][/b]
[code][/code][color=#f6b26b]By default, it shows a prompt asking which one you want to use.
If you want to manually set it to launch Skyrim, add [code]-classic[/code] as a command-line parameter (by editing the shortcut for example), or [code]-special[/code] to force SSE.[/color]
- Auto detects if SKSE/SKSE64 (for SSE) is installed, otherwise defaults to the Skyrim Launcher, otherwise launches the main Skyrim .exe directly
- Remembers the service status before skyrim was launched and restores it after it closes (this means it does nothing if the service was disabled already)



[b][color=#a4c2f4][size=4]Translations ?[/size][/color][/b]
This runs entirely headless when everything is OK, only error messages need to be localized. For now English, French and Russian are available, but if you want to port it to your particular locale, I can provide you with a .resx file (you will need Visual Studio to edit it) and will integrate the translation into a future release.

[color=#a4c2f4][size=4][b]Thanks[/b][/size][/color][color=#6fa8dc][size=4][b]
[/b][/size][/color]Bethesda and Microsoft for providing us with such quality programs ;
The various places where I found this strange solution than ended up working for me ;
Nexus for the plethora of mods and tips ;
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/50442296]divannk[/url] for providing a Russian translation.[/font]
